content: list of commonly used abbreviations please visit loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times yo pull through all kelbournewoolens com/abbreviations loops on hook puff st yo insert hook into st yo pull up a loop five times yo pull through 11 loops on hook chain 1 to close the st magic_ring optional in lieu of chain 5 ring 1 / with cc1 working front to back wrap working yarn twice around fingers tail should be away from you and ball end towards you closest to tips of fingers 2 / with hook go under two wraps and grab yarn this should be the end closest to the ball 3 / bring up a loop and slide fingers out of the ring this counts as your first chain ©2021 kelbourne woolens all rights reserved 2 granny square blanket ccoouurrttnneeyy kkeelllleeyy puff granny square chart directions make 48 96 396 granny squares magic_ring 1 / with cc1 working front to back wrap working yarn twice around fingers tail should be away from you and ball end towards you closest to tips of fingers 2 / with hook go under two wraps and grab yarn this should be the end closest to the ball 3 / bring up a loop and slide fingers out of the ring this counts as your first chain round 1 cc 1 ch3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet slip_stitch in top of beg chain 3 slip_stitch across 2 double_crochet to first chain 2 space round 2 cc 2 chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in corner chain 2 space *chain 2 double 3 double_crochet repeat from * 2 times more chain 2 slip_stitch in top of beg chain 3 slip_stitch across 2 double_crochet to first chain 2 space round 3 cc 3 chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in corner chain 2 space *chain 2 3 double_crochet in next chain 2 space chain 2 double 3 double_crochet in next chain 2 space repeat from * 2 times more 3 double_crochet in next chain 2 space chain 2 slip_stitch in top of beg chain 3 slip_stitch across 2 double_crochet to first chain 2 space round 4 mc chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in corner chain 2 space * chain 2 3 double_crochet in next chain 2 space twice chain 2 double 3 double_crochet in next chain chart key 2 space repeat from * 2 times more chain 2 3 double_crochet in next chain 2 space magic_ring twice chain 2 slip_stitch in top of beg chain 3 slip_stitch across 2 double_crochet to first chain 2 space fasten_off chain chain finishing slip_stitch slip_stitch sew squares together using the invisible seam method 1 / with right sides facing hold the squares together with single_crochet single_crochet the edges perpendicular to you 2 / starting at the corner insert your tapestry needle into double_crochet double_crochet the corner of the square closest to you next insert your needle
